The Road Ahead: Facilities and Enrollment

nav.div: Winneconne Community School District » News » District News » School Closure

div.img:
April 15, 2020
Once again, we sincerely thank you for your continued understanding and support during these uncertain times. As you likely already know, Gov. Tony Evers announced yesterday that all Wisconsin school buildings will remain closed for the rest of the 2019-2020 school year. The state’s Safer-at-Home order has been extended until May 26 and under that order, all WCSD school facilities, playgrounds and athletic fields remain closed. However, we will continue our breakfast/lunch delivery program. We have affectionately named this “Operation Lunchbox.” This program has been deemed essential and necessary. Please continue to complete the breakfast/lunch survey by 5PM on Fridays for the coming week. The lunch survey can be found on Facebook or on the District’s website at http://www.winneconne.k12.wi.us/news/district_news/important_updates. The survey will be posted by Wednesday at noon each week.
Please do not hesitate to reach out to me or your building level principal with questions/concerns.
Respectfully,
Dr. Peggy Larson
Winneconne Community School District
